translation: Being free of stinginess and narrow-minded, he arouses unremitting compassion but wants to fulfill the wishes of sentient beings. Giving in this way obtains an inexhaustible reward from the Tathāgata’s field.

source_sentence: 會當解了正覺之慧，能以財寶施與眾生，令使一切各得快樂，願此眾德著於無上正真道中。
translation: The assembly will understand the wisdom of the right awakening and be able to give it to sentient beings with wealth and treasure so that they all attain happiness, wishing that these virtues are attached to the unsurpassed true path.

source_sentence: 舍利弗！
translation: Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 其有得聞斯佛名者，及諸如來功德名號，加廣宣傳稱揚說時，若有不信謗毀之者，
translation: Anyone who hears the name of this buddha or the names of the virtues of all the buddhas and extensively proclaims it, even if they don’t believe it.

source_sentence: 四十億歲在加羅秀領泥犁之中具受眾苦。
translation: For 4 billion years, he'll be in the middle of a mud plow led by Kālā Xiu and experience all kinds of suffering.

source_sentence: 「復次，舍利弗！
translation: Furthermore, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 南方去此花香世界，度六千佛剎，有世界名曰喜起，其國有佛，號曰無憂如來、至真、等正覺、明行成為、善逝、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師，
translation: In the southern direction, past this world Flower Fragrance World and six thousand buddha-lands to the south, is a world called Joy Arising. In that world there is a buddha named Sadnessless Tathāgata, Arhat, Completely Enlightened, Completely Awakened, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct of Wisdom, Well-gone, Knower of the World

source_sentence: 號曰眾祐，度人無量。
translation: His name was Zhuoyu, and the number of his disciples was immeasurable.

source_sentence: 其有得聞無憂如來名號者，發歡喜心，信樂諷誦，斯諸人等於眾欲中無所污染，
translation: Those who hear the name of the Buddha Sadnessless Tathāgata will be delighted, and they will recite it with faith. All these people will not be polluted by desire or craving.

source_sentence: 不為諸欲之所拘礙，心如蓮花不著塵水，得不退轉，悉能安隱一切眾生。
translation: Not being hindered by desires, his mind is like a lotus flower that doesn't cling to dust and water, attains nonregression, and can all be peaceful to all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 後成正覺，若有眾生聞其名號，至心諷誦，歡喜信樂，若存在世、若泥曰後，
translation: If there are sentient beings who hear his name and sincerely recite it, they will be delighted and believe in it.

source_sentence: 斯等亦得最特妙乘，為世導師，皆當逮得無量功德；
translation: They will all attain immeasurable virtue as world leaders and guides.

source_sentence: 所生之處，其人未曾不值佛時。
translation: Where they're born, that person never fails to meet the Buddha at the time.

source_sentence: 「復次，舍利弗！
translation: Furthermore, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 南方去此喜起世界，度二萬佛剎，有世界名曰哀色，其國有佛號地力持踊如來、至真、等正覺、明行成為、善逝、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師，
translation: “In the southern direction, beyond this world Joy-generating World, to the extent of twenty thousand buddha- bhūmis, is a world called Sadness. In that world there is a buddha named Earth Powerful Shaking Tathāgata, Arhat, Completely Enlightened, Perfectly Enlightened in Knowledge and Practice, Well-gone, Knower of the World

source_sentence: 號曰眾祐，度人無量。
translation: His name was Zhuoyu, and the number of his disciples was immeasurable.

source_sentence: 其有得聞地力持踊如來名者，淨心歡喜，持諷誦念，五體投地而為作禮，
translation: Those who had heard the name of the Tathāgata Prabhūtaratna by means of the power of the earth, bowed to him with their five bodies and prostrated themselves.

source_sentence: 念其如來一日一夜，斯人當得立不退轉、難動如地，一切眾魔不能毀壞其人道心，
translation: If you think of the Tathāgata for one day and night, that person will be able to stand up without retreating or moving like the ground, and all Māras won't be able to disparage their people's aspirations for enlightenment.

source_sentence: 得無量慧猶若大海，斷生死路，却二十劫生死之罪。
translation: Attaining immeasurable wisdom is like a great ocean that stops the path of birth-and-death and removes the sins of 20 eons of birth-and-death.

source_sentence: 「復次，舍利弗！
translation: Furthermore, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 南方去此哀色世界，度十四佛剎，有世界名曰為天，其國有佛，號最踊躍如來、至真、等正覺、明行成為、善逝、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師，
translation: In the southern direction, past this world of sorrowful form, he crossed fourteen buddha-lands to a world called heaven. In that world there was a buddha named Supremely Joyful Tathāgata, Arhat, Completely Awakened, Perfectly Enlightened, Master of Knowledge and Conduct, Well-Gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed

source_sentence: 號曰眾祐，度人無量。
translation: His name was Zhuoyu, and the number of his disciples was immeasurable.

source_sentence: 其有得聞最踊躍如來名者，歡喜踊躍，持諷誦念，長跪叉手而為作禮，
translation: Anyone who hears the name of the Tathāgata with utmost boldness will be delighted and jump for joy. They will recite it, kneel downright, salute him by joining their palms together, and pay homage to him.

source_sentence: 當作是言：『我今禮最踊躍如來、至真、等正覺！』
translation: You should say, 'Now, I bow my respects to the Tathāgata, the supremely true and perfectly enlightened one!'

source_sentence: 此等眾生當為最特殊妙大乘之所捉持，亦能饒益一切眾生，三塗、八難悉為永除。
translation: These sentient beings will be held by the most special and marvelous great vehicle, which can also benefit all sentient beings and permanently remove the three destinies and eight difficulties.

source_sentence: 「復次，舍利弗！
translation: Furthermore, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 南方去此天世界，度八千佛剎，有世界名栴檀光，其國有佛，號曰自在王如來、至真、等正覺、明行成為、善逝、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師，
translation: In the southern direction, past this world of gods, he crossed eight thousand buddha-lands to a world called Sandalwood Light. In that world there was a buddha named Sovereign Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened, Completely Enlightened, Master of Knowledge and Conduct, Well-Departed, Knower of the World, Unsurpassed

source_sentence: 號曰眾祐，度人無量。
translation: His name was Zhuoyu, and the number of his disciples was immeasurable.

source_sentence: 其有得聞自在王如來名者，益加信樂，若更相勸持此佛名，斯皆當得無量之福。
translation: Anyone who hears the name of the Tathāgata of the sovereign king becomes increasingly faithful and happy, and if they further encourage each other to retain the name of this Buddha, they'll all attain measureless merit.

source_sentence: 舍利弗！
translation: Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 若有說此如來名時，若天、若人、龍及閱叉、一切非人，其有聞此如來名者，
translation: If there is anyone who says the name of this buddha, whether it is a god, human being, dragon, yakṣa, or non-human, and if they hear the name of this buddha.

source_sentence: 此等皆當得不退轉於正真道。
translation: These will all attain the right and true path without retrogressing.

source_sentence: 「復次，舍利弗！
translation: Furthermore, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 南方去此栴檀光世界，度二十億佛剎，有世界名一切伎樂震動，其國有佛，
translation: To the south, beyond this world of sandalwood light in the south, two billion buddha-lands were crossed: there was a world called Shaken by All Music and dances.

source_sentence: 號無量音如來、至真、等正覺、明行成為、善逝、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師，
translation: He was called Immeasurable Sound Tathāgata, the Supreme Truth, the Completely Enlightened One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the Accomplished in Knowledge and Conduct, the Well-gone One, the Understander of the World, the Unsurpassed One, the Master of the Teachings of the Way, the Teacher of Devas and Humans.

source_sentence: 號曰眾祐，度人無量。
translation: His name was Zhuoyu, and the number of his disciples was immeasurable.

source_sentence: 其有得聞無量音如來名者，歡喜信樂如來功德，當發此願：『以此功德，
translation: Anyone who hears the name of the Buddha Amitâbha Tathāgata will rejoice and believe in the virtues of the enlightened. They should make this vow:

source_sentence: 使我解了如來智慧！』
translation: Enable me to understand the Tathāgata's wisdom!'

source_sentence: 斯皆當住不退轉地，必成無上正真之道。
translation: All of these will abide in the stage of nonretrogression, and they'll surely become the unsurpassed true path.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 此如來尊為菩薩時，興大弘誓，立此願故。
translation: This is because the Tathāgata, the honored one, made a great vow when he was a bodhisattva and established this vow.

source_sentence: 若有不信誹謗之者，於地獄中長受眾苦；
translation: Those who do not believe in this doctrine and denigrate it will be tormented for a long time in hell.

source_sentence: 罪畢得出，所生之處常不遇值諸佛之世。
translation: After their sins have been expiated, they'll always fail to meet the buddhas where they're born.

source_sentence: 舍利弗！
translation: Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 其佛世界何故名曰伎樂震動？
translation: Why is that buddha world called the shaken by music?

source_sentence: 無量音佛本從兜術降神之時，始發一切伎樂之音聲，普震動揚其樂音聲，
translation: When the Buddha of Immeasurable Sound had originally descended from Tuṣita Heaven, he began to sound all kinds of music.

source_sentence: 天上、世間乃至非人一切伎樂所不能及；
translation: They cannot be outshone by all the music and dances of celestial, mundane, human, or nonhuman beings.

source_sentence: 其佛住壽在世之時，說法教化至于泥曰；
translation: When the Buddha was living in the world, he preached the Dharma and led his disciples up to Nirvana.

source_sentence: 其佛國土伎樂之音聲續美暢，震于十方二十佛剎。
translation: The sound of the buddha-lands' music continues to be beautiful, and it shakes 20 buddha-blocs in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 以是之故，號無量音。
translation: Because of this, it's called immeasurable sound.

source_sentence: 「復次，舍利弗！
translation: Furthermore, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 南方去此一切伎樂震動世界，度三百億佛剎，有世界名集光明，其國有佛，
translation: In the south, beyond this world shaken by all music and dances, past three hundred myriads of koṭis of buddha-lands, there was a world called Light Arising, in which there was a buddha.

source_sentence: 號曰錠光如來、至真、等正覺、明行成為、善逝、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師，
translation: He was named Dīpaṃkara Tathāgata, the Supreme Truth, the Completely Enlightened One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the Accomplished in Knowledge and Conduct, the Well-gone One, the Understander of the World, the Unsurpassed One, the Master of the Way, the Master of Dharma, the Teacher of Devas and Humans.

source_sentence: 號曰眾祐，度人無量。
translation: His name was Zhuoyu, and the number of his disciples was immeasurable.

source_sentence: 舍利弗！
translation: Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 其如來尊停住光明，照他佛國，十萬億剎常以大明，以是之故名曰錠光。
translation: The Tathāgata, the Honored One, abiding in that light, illumines other buddha lands and always shines brightly with great luminosity in a hundred thousand myriads of koṭis of buddha-lands. Because of this, he is called Dīpaṅkara.

source_sentence: 其有得聞斯佛名者，一心信樂，歡喜踊躍，無諛諂意，斯等當為如來光明之所護持。
translation: Anyone who hears the name of this buddha should wholeheartedly believe in it, rejoice and dance with joy. They should be protected by the Tathāgata’s ray of light.

source_sentence: 「復次，舍利弗！
translation: Furthermore, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 南方去此集光明世界，度八萬佛剎，有世界名一切香，其國有佛，號寶光明如來、至真、等正覺、明行成為、善逝、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師，
translation: In the southern direction from this world Light of Assembly, he crossed eighty thousand buddha-lands to a world called All Fragrances. In that world there was a buddha named Jewel Light Tathāgata, Completely Enlightened, Perfectly Enlightened, Developed in Knowledge and Conduct, Well-gone, Knower of the World, Unsurpassed,

source_sentence: 號曰眾祐，度人無量。
translation: His name was Zhuoyu, and the number of his disciples was immeasurable.

source_sentence: 其有得聞寶光明如來名者，歡喜信樂，持諷誦念，斯等皆當為於世間作大珍寶，
translation: Those who hear the name of the Buddha Jewel Light will become joyful and faithful, reciting it. They will all become great treasures for the sake of the world.

source_sentence: 住不退轉於正真道；
translation: They abide in the path of nonregression and turn to the true path.

source_sentence: 所生之處常值佛世，初不曾生無佛之處；
translation: Wherever they are born, they always meet buddha-worlds; never being born in a buddhaless land at first.

source_sentence: 遊於菩薩徑路之時，却五十劫生死之罪。
translation: When he travels along the path of the bodhisattva, he stops the sin of birth-and-death for fifty eons.

source_sentence: 是故，舍利弗！
translation: Therefore, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 不當起於瞋恚、忿亂向諸菩薩及諸弟子，惟當興立大慈之心而奉敬之；
translation: They should not give rise to anger or resentment toward enlightening beings and their disciples; rather, they should develop great compassion and venerate them.

source_sentence: 當求如來廣妙之慧，發弘誓願趣至大乘。
translation: You should seek the Tathāgata's extensive and marvelous wisdom, make a great vow, and proceed to the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 舍利弗！
translation: Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 如是其人疾近無上正真之道，廣演如來深妙之法。
translation: Thus, that person quickly approaches the unsurpassed true path and extensively explains the Tathāgata's profound and marvelous teaching.

source_sentence: 若使有人未入泥洹，在菩薩之境界者，不信佛法，亦不信有行菩薩道，
translation: Suppose there is someone who has not yet entered nirvana but does not believe in the buddha-dharma or practice the bodhisattva path.

source_sentence: 言佛道難得。
translation: It means the Buddha Way is difficult to attain.

source_sentence: 如是之人，滿於千歲在地獄中具受眾罪。
translation: A person like this will spend a thousand years in hell suffering all kinds of punishments.

source_sentence: 是故，舍利弗！
translation: Therefore, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 不當起瞋恚之意向於虫蠡，況持惡意向諸快士。
translation: They shouldn't give rise to angry thoughts about insects and Li, much less those who hold bad thoughts for fast men.

source_sentence: 癡蓋所覆、無慚愧者，於中謗毀益牢地獄諸罪之行。
translation: Being covered by the hindrance of delusion and lacking shame, they denigrate the sins that are committed in prison.

source_sentence: 舍利弗！
translation: Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 諸佛興世甚難、甚難，百億之數發意求道，至時得者若一、若兩。
translation: When the buddhas arise in the world, it's very difficult and difficult, and 10 billion people give rise to the intention to seek the path, whether one or two times they attain it.

source_sentence: 當知，舍利弗！
translation: You should know, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 如來興世如優曇花，時時乃有，不可見也。
translation: The Tathāgata flourishes in the world like the udumbara flower, which is present from time to time but invisible.

source_sentence: 其求大乘，發弘誓願，已有發者、甫當發者、今現發者，起勇猛意、不沈疑者，
translation: Those who seek the great vehicle and make a great vow, those who have already undertaken it, those who will undertake it in the future, and those who are undertaking it now give rise to courageous aspirations and don’t doubt.

source_sentence: 當如所願疾成不久，廣施法食，具正覺道。
translation: Soon after your wish will be fulfilled, you will give widely the food of the Dharma and complete the path of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 如是南方諸佛之等不可稱計，今現康常，廣說經法。
translation: Thus, the buddhas of the south can't be counted, but now they're so peaceful and constant that they explain the sūtras and teachings in detail.

source_sentence: 其有聞者，廣演、興顯、歎揚如來無量功德，當向南方五體投地，念諸如來，
translation: Those who have heard it will extensively expound, glorify, and praise the immeasurable virtues of the Tathāgatas. They will face south and prostrate themselves five-legged on the ground in remembrance of the Tathāgatas.

source_sentence: 稱其名號而為作禮，其人得福不可計量。
translation: If someone praises their name and pays homage to them, that person's merit will be immeasurable.

source_sentence: 佛說稱揚諸佛功德經卷中
translation: Foshuo xiangyang zhoufo gongde jing, vol. 1
